mathematics
  specialized relating to or involving addition (= the process of adding numbers together): Let Z be the additive group of integers. The strategy is applicable to single-winner voting systems that are additive point systems.
formal involving combining things or using things together: Creating colours on a screen is an additive process, in which the primary colours are red, green, and blue.
formal increasing by being combined, or increasing over time: Jenkins predicted a powerful additive effect might occur when these cholesterol-lowering foods are combined. RA is an additive polyarthritis. This means that it affects more joints as time passes.
More examplesFewer examplesA +3 cm crest and a -3 cm trough result in a height of zero, i.e., the waves momentarily cancel each other out at that point. This additive rule is referred to as the principle of superposition, "superposition" being merely a fancy word for "adding".An additive solution concept assigns to every player in {υ + ω} the sum of what he would receive in υ and ω.FDM is an additive process in which a layer of plastic is extruded on top of the previous layer, one at a time. Researchers are concerned these drugs may have an additive effect - where small concentrations of two or more drugs become more poisonous when absorbed together at the same time.The mixture of alcohol and heroin has an additive effect: a drinker could take a lower-than-lethal dose and still OD.
